radiographic_examinations.findings: Appendix is hyperemic and enlarged with significant surrounding stranding and dilatation up to 19 mm in maximal diameter associated with a tip periappendiceal phlegmon/abscess measuring 1.8 x 1.6 cm. No frank free air. Minimal if any secondary thickening involving the cecal tip. Lung bases are clear with dependent atelectasis; heart normal in size; liver without focal lesion; gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands unremarkable; kidneys enhance symmetrically; small bowel loops completely collapsed; colon not dilated; great vessels patent; no mesenteric or retroperitoneal adenopathy by size criteria. Bladder, distal ureters, prostate, and rectum appear within normal limits. No inguinal or pelvic sidewall lymphadenopathy. No free fluid within the pelvis.
